Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Super-oxidized Solution for Surgical-site Infection Prevention in Open Appendicectomy

Participants.evidence: Patients aged 13 years and older with perforated appendicitis undergoing open appendicectomy

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive peritoneal and wound lavage with either super-oxidized solution or normal saline

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effect of super-oxidized solution in reducing SSI risk.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was SSI within 30 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated with allocation concealment using opaque, sequentially numbered, sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Patients, surgeons, outcome assessors, and statisticians were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 102 patients were randomised (51 per group)

Result_Outcome.evidence: The super-oxidized solution group showed a significant reduction in overall SSI (15.6% vs. 37.2%; RR 0.42; 95% CI 0.20 to 0.87; P = 0.014)

Funding.evidence: Funding: Ministry of Health Research Grant
